elements.2211.03247_e764f93a44f82433a249d9f9554a6: We propose an optical localization and polarization microscopy scheme with sub-nanometer precision for an emitter (atom/molecule/quantum dot) based on its Lamb shift
elements.2211.03247_b3252ce24ab08975238eddc69cb3c: It is revealed that the position-ultra-sensitive giant Lamb shift with three or more orders of magnitude larger than that in the free space, can be induced by higher-order plasmonic dark modes of a metal nanoparticle
elements.2211.03247_a415319a31501e42b5ae81d18be93: More importantly, this giant Lamb shift can be ultra-sensitively observed from the optical scattering spectrum of the nanoparticle via scanning an emitter by a sub-nanometer step, and the orientation of the Lamb shift image can be utilized to identify the dipole polarization of the emitter
elements.2211.03247_9c9bcda1121302eb1c2e7b33d39d9: They enable the optical spectrum microscope technology with angstrom precision and polarization identification, which will bring about broad applications in many fields, such as physics, chemistry, medicine, life science and materials science.
elements.2211.03247_d1da54b3dc4582bd94983407abeed: The optical microscope is widely used to localize and image objects which cannot be directly observed by the human eyes
elements.2211.03247_7e537e228ae6fd9953aecf424c858: However, the resolution of the conventional optical microscope is subjected to the well-known Abbe's diffraction limit, i.e., the resolvable smallest distance is about half wavelength of the detection light
elements.2211.03247_bffde62d2f5d53c06a3a38cf6fcdf: For visible light, the spatial resolution is about 250-300 nm
elements.2211.03247_0b311c80c3bff5187a035e083e2d9: In the past few decades, several superresolution methods have been proposed to surpass the diffraction limit, such as the Stimulated Emission Depletion Microscopy (STED)
elements.2211.03247_fd1857aa390e0b13ef451f5839532: These methods have been widely used for biological imaging with typical resolutions being about 20-50 nm
elements.2211.03247_e656c1de6fcca4caba8109bf4f6fd: The near-field optical scanning microscope (NOSM) is in principle not subjected to the diffraction limit, but the achievable minimum resolution is about 10 nm in practice
elements.2211.03247_128512a842ccd5e4a8efda60ab28b: To achieve atomic-level resolution, the scanning tunneling microscopy (STM) and atomic force microscopy (AFM) are commonly used
elements.2211.03247_2e1117915bc40f64002ab81c99e56: The resolution gains of STM and AFM are, however, at the expense of losing the spectroscopic properties of the sample and the requirement of extreme environment conditions
elements.2211.03247_7d06fa569f62d44894a7291dcbe8a: With the help of quantum effects, such as using quantum entanglement
elements.2211.03247_1730ac1ff33a64895345dd7995db5: , the optical diffraction limit can in principle be broken through, but only very few schemes have been demonstrated a resolution below 10 nm
elements.2211.03247_ecf0e6cd12cb4ec55e2bcd5ae7d18: Hence, it is very significant to find an optical localization method with atomic-level precision based upon quantum effects.
elements.2211.03247_c0cfbe08d45d58fb5335148dddc4c: Quantum theory predicts that vacuum is not truly empty, but full of fluctuations where virtual particles are constantly created and annihilated
elements.2211.03247_c92672bc27402d2ed7af2906f00e5: which can lead to many interesting quantum effects
elements.2211.03247_63f4dcae7ccfd16de089ed519137c: Among the observable effects of the electromagnetic vacuum, the Lamb shift (LS) is one of the most important effects which directly stimulated the emerging of modern quantum electrodynamics theory, and its precious measurement becomes an important testbed for quantum field theory
elements.2211.03247_9bac5c675e21c745e0aee7f53881a: Through vacuum engineering, the LS of a quantum emitter can be significantly modified
elements.2211.03247_1ce30dccae6ec83ff30162e9ecd97: , e.g., a QE near band edge of photonic crystal can have energy shift one to two orders of magnitudes larger than that in the normal vacuum
elements.2211.03247_d70c58f3f2688dfca38416c947210: Due to the much stronger confinement of vacuum field in the plasmonic system
elements.2211.03247_592aa5fbfe94543467e8b081456cf: , the Lamb shift of an emitter very close to a plasmonic nanostructure can also be strongly amplified
elements.2211.03247_26faff93b38c8646c5451bb51d897: Here, we show that the giant Lamb shift in the plasmon-emitter coupling system is ultra-sensitive to the emitter position and can be observed either from the spontaneous emission spectrum peak shift or the scattering spectrum dip shift with variation of tens meV/nm when the nanoparticle scans through the quantum emitter
elements.2211.03247_b45fd9ee463e4be8ba3bd80a69357: We propose that this quantum effect can be applied to localize the position of an emitter precisely and construct the Lamb shift imaging by scanning the nanoparticle through the emitter
elements.2211.03247_61ff7a4bb4eae8a82824cfd2b2eb2: The obtained imaging spot is of angstrom size and its shape evidently depends on the dipole orientation of the emitter
elements.2211.03247_36b33b2a2c5b83ba6d226dabf3d88: These findings can in principle be developed as a Lamb-shift-based superresolution scanning optical microscope with atomic-level resolution and it also works even when the emitter is embedded below a dielectric substrate which may bring about broad applications in many fields.
elements.2211.03247_bbf59edace6ad44cb5019d749582c: The article is organized as follows
elements.2211.03247_704d767a995302a989072473fd200: , we first describe the model under study and illustrate the theory used to calculate the emission and scattering spectra of this system including the effect of Lamb shift
elements.2211.03247_047e6b164dcfff8faf43da38102f3: Particularly, we study the spectrum shift as a function of emitter-nanoparticle distance and propose an experimentally feasible method to observe the giant Lamb shift in this system
elements.2211.03247_ebedc1adc77074f48446e4434a340: , we propose a possible experimental scheme to detect the giant Lamb shift which can be used to localize the position of an emitter and its polarization even if it is embedded inside a substrate with ultra-high sensitivity

elements.2211.03247_58b784b62e7b5d722bae846d54780: (c) we can see that when the distance decreases from 20 nm to 1.5 nm, the magnitude of LS increases from almost 0 to 77.4 meV which can be observed from the scattering spectrum dip shift of about 53 meV
elements.2211.03247_e9f7a8c4f9ecac8b2ae5ea9eae80d: In particular, when the emitter-nanoparticle distance changes from 2 nm to 1.5 nm, the magnitude of LS increases by about 48 meV and the spectrum dip is red-shifted by about 27 meV
elements.2211.03247_d843efefaf43106673110a7b19128: In a typical high-resolution spectrometer, 0.02 nm wavelength difference (about 0.1 meV energy shift) can be resolved
elements.2211.03247_6c5f1b0067c4cc93988225cf91d40: Thus, from the scattering spectrum dip shift we can in principle measure emitter position change with angstrom or even sub-angstrom precision which is only limited by the precision position control of the nanoparticle
elements.2211.03247_98f067267eca1aafdca3890c53274: The precision of the scheme may be further improved if the emitter-nanoparticle distance is less than 1 nm, while in this regime the quantum effects such as quantum tunneling may play an important role which needs to be considered

elements.2211.03247_d186a9df18e95dbc36ac62eb67b94: Finally, we propose a possible realization based on the theory described above to detect the position of a quantum emitter sitting on or inside a substrate (such as SiN) as shown in Figure

elements.2211.03247_421c9c4285383bfb87764cd2a7e8c: (b) when the z distance between the emitter and tip (z-offset) is fixed to be 1 nm

elements.2211.03247_1ba32938cb06de7197521d3fc72f2: When the tip moves towards the emitter, the spectrum dip is red-shifted with gradient about 15.4 meV/nm, which indicates a much higher sensitivity for detecting the longitudinal distance
elements.2211.03247_ebc81b831b2b516e34b17dea6f813: For a spectrometer with 0.02 nm resolution, the lateral and longitudinal resolutions in this setup can be about 1
elements.2211.03247_2e3e8e254f578299c998794eecea6: If the substrate is replaced by a material with lower reflective index or the emitter is placed above the substrate surface, the LS can be even larger and the resolution can be further enhanced (see SI Sec
elements.2211.03247_8004b7108d757b9fd37f387a23aec: We can also extract a two-dimensional image of the emitter from the dip shift of the scattering spectra at different positions when the emitter is x-polarized (Figure
elements.2211.03247_9430df9443b95e581d025e0421dc9: When the emitter is z-polarized, the image is symmetric
elements.2211.03247_2f59a7f0accd6924fa31c2f7dd39c: However, when the emitter is x-polarized, the image has an elliptical shape with major axis along the polarization direction
elements.2211.03247_ce7f6cb8ac07bb6ffbadaec85a59a: Thus, in our scheme, we can not only detect the position of the emitter but also its polarization direction
elements.2211.03247_3a541c6a693515abddcb7e0ab0633: When the z-offset increases, the major axis of the imaging spot also increases which indicates the reduction of resolution (see Figure S6 in SM)
elements.2211.03247_6e6e96750e962dcfd0c047dadd861: Different from the typical tip-enhanced photoluminescence (TEPL) method which is based on the electronic tunneling excitation
elements.2211.03247_7d182fe187a43907f9e108b1bccc0: , here in our all-optical scheme the sample does not need to be placed on top of a conductor surface and it also works when the emitter is embedded slightly below a dielectric substrate which can be applied in more scenarios.
elements.2211.03247_411e77183b828c9faab55c3726568: To conclude, we show that a quantum emitter very close to a metal nanoparticle can have huge Lamb shift mainly induced by the higher-order plasmonic dark modes which should not be ignored, and this Lamb shift is ultra-sensitive to the emitter position
elements.2211.03247_5e080392ae5ddd68c7b9eab391a04: We propose that this giant Lamb shift can be observed from the scattering spectrum dip shift when the nanoparticle scans through the emitter and more importantly this quantum effect can be exploited to all-optically detect an emitter position with angstrom precision which is comparable to or even better than the traditional scanning tunneling microscopy (STM) and atomic force microscopy (AFM)
elements.2211.03247_7aa3a19239e0db6b434fcc09d46cc: In contrast to the STM and AFM which are usually surface bound and only detect the sample on top of a conductor surface, we can detect the position of the emitter precisely even if it is slightly below a dielectric substrate
elements.2211.03247_86979020e098125fc2eeffd448316: In addition, we can also determine the polarization direction of the quantum emitter, which is usually not feasible for the traditional STM and AFM
elements.2211.03247_b4ba96f80ecaa706ff1c38522e7f3: Due to the fact that the experimental measurement of the scattering spectrum is easy at room temperature and both the excitation and detection are all optical which is convenient for operation, our work here can find important applications in the many areas and can stimulate extensive theoretical and experimental researches in the future.
elements.2211.03247_7b55428b8bf39e97484b0b0082056: The authors thank R. Liu and X. Zeng for helpful discussions
elements.2211.03247_0660fdef8fe7015d519e13f1eb98f: This work was supported by the Key-Area Research and Development Program of Guangdong Province (Grant No.2018B03 0329001), the National Key R
elements.2211.03247_cd2d899e29966309fab5c13765ed0: D Program of China (Grant No. 2021YFA1400800), the Guangdong Special Support Program (Grant No.2019JC05X397), the Natural Science Foundations of Guangdong (Grant Nos. 2018A030313722 and 2021A1515010039).
elements.2211.03247_2c70ec346604a7e02afe6e58fcf4b: The authors declare no conflicts of interest.
elements.2211.03247_1b028209f31ee85fab06b1cd95cf5: Data underlying the results presented in this paper are not publicly available at this time but may be obtained from the authors upon reasonable request.
elements.2211.03247_d82c5217b8a8a635d84bcae2e41ce: The Lamb shift of a quantum emitter very close to a plasmonic nanostructure, mainly induced by the higher-order plasmonic dark modes, can be three or more orders of magnitude larger than that in the free space and it is ultra-sensitive to the emitter position and polarization
elements.2211.03247_0685581c26af3cd4b84a00654a446: We show that this giant Lamb shift can be sensitively observed from the scattering spectrum dip shift of coupled system when the plasmonic nanoparticle or tip scans through the emitter
elements.2211.03247_fda5a3cb809b3e079cf61f1b00785: Based on these observations, we propose an optical localization and polarization microscopy scheme with sub-nanometer precision for a quantum emitter via detecting the scattering spectrum instead of fluorescence
elements.2211.03247_ed334265908f486f1bb5b3be1880a: Our method is free of fluorescence quenching problem and it is relatively easier to be implemented in the plasmon-emitter coupling system
elements.2211.03247_8ef7183dc74230fbd41704298daa2: Moreover, the sample in our method does not need to be placed inside a plasmonic picocavity to enhance the radiative fluorescence rate and it also works even if the quantum emitter is slightly below a dielectric surface which can bring about broader applications in various fields, such as physics, chemistry, medicine, life science and materials science.
elements.2211.03247_86e9de0c9a8594670f793f4919cec: In the past few decades, several superresolution methods have been proposed to surpass the diffraction limit, such as the stimulated emission depletion microscopy (STED)
elements.2211.03247_6168bb45ecea38a4a3d214ac0f9ce: These methods have been widely used for biological imaging with typical resolution being about 20-50 nm
elements.2211.03247_42e6ff8304addceeef6b4947036bd: The near-field scanning optical microscope (NSOM) can collect the evanescent field and is in principle not subjected to the diffraction limit, but the achievable minimum resolution to date is about 10 nm in practice
elements.2211.03247_f659fb88777b9b123c0ddab624b63: , the optical diffraction limit can also be overcome, but the resolutions demonstrated by these methods are still far from a few nanometers
elements.2211.03247_c5421fdec883b868e357bd000d9d5: Using the highly localized tunneling electrons as a source of excitation, a technique called STM-induced luminescence (STML) can achieve spectral characterization with sub-nanometer spatial resolution
elements.2211.03247_51e38ca80f374bc588a2a9dfb3c82: However, since the electronic tunneling excitation has some limitations, it is a long-standing pursuing goal to achieve sub-nanometer resolution using all-optical methods
elements.2211.03247_ea5dc963cb79ce0378416148e8a88: It is well-known that the plasmonic system can confine the light field in an extremely tiny volume
elements.2211.03247_7eb2f93eaf1ad9f99cbf5a99f76e7: , which is widely used to enhance the interaction between light and quantum emitters (atom,molecule,quantum dot and so on)
elements.2211.03247_e324162fb7629e4f6f94f6b384a4e: The typical STM junction is actually a plasmonic picocavity which can confine the light field down to sub-nanometer scale
elements.2211.03247_9c4b2ffa3a05912b72148e8e883ad: and it can also enhance the field strength orders of magnitude which has been used for demonstrating the tip-enhanced Raman spectroscopy (TERS) with atomic resolution
elements.2211.03247_dce6ccecb28a57d3734c5c93802f5: In addition, the plasmonic picocavity can act as an antenna which can enhance the fluorescence emission rate of a quantum emitter inside the cavity
elements.2211.03247_c5c157418bff1a367027c92fda9ff: and it was also applied to demonstrate the tip-enhanced photoluminescence (TEPL) with sub-nanometer resolution
elements.2211.03247_15b1fa4a283a8024e80f445719426: In both the TERS and TEPL, the target emitters need to be placed inside the plasmonic picocavity which may limit its applications
elements.2211.03247_6fa66a730e3c26ee9d8a0c6f59430: Considering that the scattering spectrum is much easier to be observed in the plasmonic-emitter coupling system
elements.2211.03247_61835c78c5ddd8b1ba1191a4e008c: , it is thus very interesting to devise a plasmonic scanning localization microscopy with ultra-high resolution via its scattering spectrum
elements.2211.03247_67bcffe9fb06f5cb425ae58b74d12: In this article, we propose an optical scattering imaging (OSI) method with sub-nanometer resolution based on the scattering spectrum shift induced by the plasmon-enhanced Lamb shift when a plasmonic nanoparticle or tip scans through a quantum emitter
elements.2211.03247_557e98c9dcb3e5916898e98d50a2a: As is known, quantum theory predicts that vacuum is not truly empty, but full of fluctuations where virtual particles are constantly created and annihilated
elements.2211.03247_aa57a692e64eb73c7a43b6c5f2445: Due to the much stronger field confinement, the Lamb shift of an emitter very close to a plasmonic nanostructure can be strongly amplified
elements.2211.03247_15e4dbb99928a819bd74797ae5d1c: and has also been experimentally observed
elements.2211.03247_58a2557fe935a8d160c80c367056b: Here, we show that the giant Lamb shift in the plasmon-emitter coupling system, mainly induced by the higher-order plasmonic dark modes when the emitter is very close to the plasmonic nanostructure, is ultra-sensitive to the emitter position and it can be observed from the scattering spectrum dip shift of the coupled system with variation of several meV/nm when the metal nanoparticle or tip scans through the quantum emitter
elements.2211.03247_3644590f509bfbbf11d6952564b81: Due to these observations, we propose that this quantum effect can be exploited to localize the position of an emitter precisely and construct the Lamb shift imaging by scanning the plasmonic nanoparticle or tip through the emitter
elements.2211.03247_2607ac72e51121a98c78bbdf557cb: Since our method is based on scattering spectrum instead of fluorescence, it is free of fluorescence quenching problem and compared with the usual STML and TEPL methods, our scheme does not require that the sample is placed inside a plasmonic picocavity
elements.2211.03247_911f626f081563bbd002cb8d302b9: The findings here can in principle be developed as a Lamb-shift-based superresolution scanning optical microscope with atomic-level resolution and it also works even when the emitter is embedded slightly below a dielectric substrate, which can bring about broader applications in various fields
elements.2211.03247_df87634d238933e6bbfb97c98131c: Particularly, we study the scattering spectrum shift as a function of emitter-nanoparticle distance and propose an experimentally feasible method to observe the giant Lamb shift in this system
elements.2211.03247_988dfcfe243060df86a2ddfc2b4bf: , we propose a possible experimental scheme based on tip-scattering method to detect the giant Lamb shift which can be used to localize the position of an emitter and its polarization even if it is embedded inside a substrate with ultra-high sensitivity
elements.2211.03247_e9115b5c2f57461fd8bd49c7f7d46: The schematic system considered here is shown in Fig.
elements.2211.03247_fd98851b9fe89101bb60838a4908b: In this paper, we mainly consider that
elements.2211.03247_8c18cd0176dab764d311dffcf765d: where the electron tunnelling effect and nonlocal optical response can be neglected
elements.2211.03247_061636577ed5efbdad98825c38746: The MNP can support many localized surface plasmon modes with the dipole mode being the bright mode and the higher-order modes (HOMs) being the dark modes
elements.2211.03247_a203e16646f4a9734fedbb5ce9aa2: Considering that the dipole mode can be effectively excited by the incident light and be scattered into the far field while the HOMs do not
elements.2211.03247_d7fc4fd04d367e4dcb474c477b024: , it is convenient to treat the dipole mode as a quantized pseudo-mode separately
elements.2211.03247_ee5c6e09dfa115c002f217c0f51e1: and leave the HOMs as background reservoir fields which can be well described by the macroscopic quantization method based on dyadic Green's function
elements.2211.03247_c4294c9ec51b2bdf3161c7ef60399: where the first term is the effective emitter energy, the second term is the effective plasmon dipole energy, the third term is the interaction between the emitter and the dipole mode, and the four term desribes the effect of the HOMs with
elements.2211.03247_97a04fd4a8e977e9e10f21249c36a: The first term in Eq. (2) is the Hamiltonian of the HOMs and the second term is the interaction between the HOMs and QE where the non-rotating interaction terms are retained for the correct calculation of Lamb shift.
elements.2211.03247_bcd4db30a91c215bb3d56b8cf8bc8: and the magnitude of the effective plasmon dipole moment
elements.2211.03247_6ef2a458c8f7bb76b228cbf3b04a3: When the distance between the emitter and the nanoparticle is of the order of or larger than the radius of the nanoparticle, the dipole mode dominates (see upper panel of Fig.
elements.2211.03247_24c1faee3004077cb98cca4914c21: However, when the emitter is very close to the nanoparticle, the HOMs can have larger spectral density than that of the dipole mode (see lower panel of Fig.
elements.2211.03247_f0e3ae55f78a72d297c2f312d3e54: The equivalence can be seen from Fig.
elements.2211.03247_3384b8fdba6841d306626e3ad4c19: On the contrary, the HOMs have little effect on the decay rate but have significant effect on the LS even though the bare emitter transition frequency is far-off resonant from the HOMsâ frequencies, as shown in Fig.
elements.2211.03247_ed2e9ed524979b15bd54bf369a397: From Fig. 2(a), we can see that the emission spectrum peak is red-shifted and the linewidth is also broaden when the nanoparticle moves towards the emitter which provides a method to observe the LS in this system and similar phenomena have also been experimentally observed in the plasmonic nanocavity system
elements.2211.03247_2e3e9fe0ef779c5c0c1a99848a1f0: Although the coupling strength increases when the emitter is closer to the nanoparticle, we do not observe fluorescence splitting because the damping rate also increases rapidly and thus no spectrum splitting is observed in Fig.
elements.2211.03247_c54e58f4cde663c9fad478e6ece14: We should also mention that in Fig.
elements.2211.03247_42f1499533b0f316e94bc0509c311: (a) we show the emitter fluorescence spectrum shape but its real intensity in the far field also depends on the quantum yield
elements.2211.03247_65b44fb3bb162160cbe5647044a2a: In addition, the spectrum shown in Equation (
elements.2211.03247_45be61a85c748a27382950fd96e3d: ) is the fluorescence spectrum when only the emitter is initially excited which is not easy to be realized in this system because the cross section of the nanoparticle is usually much larger than that of the quantum emitter
elements.2211.03247_31886fc27ade5122476194327d6d5: To enhance the quantum yield of the fluorescence, a plasmonic cavity together with a dielectric spacer is usually required
elements.2211.03247_84a0ea7cca42745f99529c8f09bd0: which may limit its application scenarios
elements.2211.03247_5fa9a8184bef40fed1a209c42b57d: Next, we show that the LS can also be observed from the scattering spectrum of the system under weak driving field, which is much easier to be experimentally implemented.
elements.2211.03247_c72115df164ad0979223e120b149f: The scattering spectrum as a function of the emitter distance is shown in Fig.
elements.2211.03247_fada54765825661f8fa6e0e03e095: Different from the spontaneous emission spectrum, there is usually a spectrum dip in the scattering spectrum due to the Fano-like interfernce even if the strong coupling condition is not met
elements.2211.03247_7b123954797df046f22c9225df029: The LS, emission peak shift and scattering spectrum dip shift as a function of emitter position are shown in Fig.
elements.2211.03247_dfb1dc8cb3e8da0fc0574cdb37b48: The precision of the scheme may be further improved if the emitter-nanoparticle distance is less than 1 nm, while in this regime the quantum effects such as quantum tunneling and nonlocal effects may play an important role which needs to be considered
elements.2211.03247_95796fe0a8e9e8733f57b37007a07: The scattering spectra for different emitter polarizations are shown in Fig.
elements.2211.03247_711bf3e93099152923af57f09dae0: The dip shift is maximum when the polarization of the emitter is along the z-direction while it is minimum when it is along the x-direction (Fig.
elements.2211.03247_c4299d762fbc9ebae4a3b01e5df71: is also shown in the inset of Fig.
elements.2211.03247_446dd607535e16eefe2b43d397177: Finally, we propose a possible realization based on the theory described above to detect the position of a quantum emitter sitting on or inside a substrate (such as SiN) as shown in Fig.
elements.2211.03247_4754f5fa5126f42336a123decc4db: The field intensity distribution when the tip is 0.5 nm above the surface is also shown in right panel of Fig.
elements.2211.03247_b644e1740d72e8c9a6e39f1941f34: A light beam is applied to the tip and the scattering spectra for different tip lateral positions are shown in Fig.
elements.2211.03247_689871ce8ae6caf9ff5f59658bdaf: The dip shift and the LS as a function of lateral offset are shown in Fig.
elements.2211.03247_8fcbe0fb85238144a011d299e71fc: When the tip is right on top of the emitter, the spectrum dip shift as a function of z distance is shown in Fig.
elements.2211.03247_c617b58d19c3aff693cc7fb42d027: For a spectrometer with 0.02 nm resolution, the lateral and longitudinal resolutions in this setup can in principle be about 1
elements.2211.03247_a33f413195d770a9f5a0a4a0ca710: We can also extract a two-dimensional image of the emitter from the dip shift of the scattering spectra at different positions when the emitter is x-polarized (Fig.
elements.2211.03247_9271140a082814ceeec5af55690ea: When the z-offset increases, the major axis of the imaging spot also increases which indicates the reduction of resolution (see Fig. S6 in SM)
elements.2211.03247_6d635a74ee3bfccf76b98e31b16ad: Different from the typical STML and TEPL methods
elements.2211.03247_e133d6548c1b4b0f6b7f4fb1b5873: , here our scheme does not require the formation of plasmonic picocavity to enhance the fluorescence rate and it also works even when the emitter is embedded slightly below a dielectric substrate which may find more application scenarios.
elements.2211.03247_6c752d7c4303c642f9e0372302dd7: To conclude, we show that a quantum emitter very close to a metal nanoparticle or tip can have huge Lamb shift mainly induced by the higher-order plasmonic dark modes and this energy shift is ultra-sensitive to the emitter position
elements.2211.03247_3bd0e50b04dd1214b0c6c06ef9325: We also show that this giant Lamb shift can be sensitively observed from the scattering spectrum dip shift when the metal nanoparticle or tip scans through the emitter
elements.2211.03247_e397201352126c9dc7c4bbb0dc310: Moreover, we propose that this quantum effect can be exploited for all-optical detection of an emitter position with angstrom precision which is comparable to the typical STM, STML and TEPL methods and we can also determine the polarization direction of the quantum emitter
elements.2211.03247_ed06abcd46f9579878e77321e48b6: In contrast to the typical STML and TEPL methods which are usually surface bound and only detect the sample in a plasmonic picocavity, we can detect the position of the emitter precisely even if it is slightly below a dielectric substrate
elements.2211.03247_af80cbe109f71959d9e0b50b898e7: Due to the fact that the experimental measurement of the scattering spectrum is much easier than the fluorescence in the plasmon-emitter coupling system, our work here can find important applications in many areas and can stimulate extensive theoretical and experimental researches in the future
elements.2211.03247_d6690dcf9ef7412faadec7ba99f19: Finally, we should mention that the emitter is treated as a point dipole in this work to demonstrate the basic principle, the full scattering spectrum considering the non-dipolar effect of the quantum emitter and other quantum effects should be further studied in the future
